page.title: 10PEOPLE IN CLIFTON HAMPDEN
page.content:
The population of the village of Clifton Hampden is only about 650. A few hundred more people live in the western end of Burcot and there are a number of isolated farms and cottages scattered throughout the area.
It is a very mixed population, varying from old people who have lived in the village for forty years or more to newcomers, some foreign, who have moved into the area since JET was set up.About 25% of the village population is retired. Business people are increasingly settling here, taking advantage of either Culham or Didcot railway stations to commute to London. The staff of the European School at Culham make it a floating, and to some extent a multinational, population.
